fields.summary: Completely remove HTML and RSS macros from JIRA
Enable gadgets to have scrollbars instead of multiple pages
Configurable display of full name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32169].
  {panel}

It would be nice having meaning ful urls for fix versions. Right now the links looks like 
http://mybuildingorg.jira.com/browse/MB/fixforversion/10201 

That number doesn't say alot when we emailed it.

If it could be http://mybuildingorg.jira.com/browse/MB/version/1.1.17 instead, it would be great.
fields.summary: meaningful URLs for versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32168].
  {panel}

It would be beneficial so we can manage the volume of emails from JIRA if there were email headers set which indicates what properties in the issue have changed.  Sometimes other parts of the issue like the Description, etc. are included even when they haven't changed.

Ideally it would be helpful to be able to filter when the change notification is because either a comment, the description or the assignee has changed.

Also, it would be helpful to detect whether the version that an issue has been moved to matches a particular condition (i.e. an issue has been moved into an iteration).

This probably isn't a Studio enhancement (or maybe it is), but may actually be a JIRA enhancement.  But it would really help us better manage the email volume.

Thanks!
fields.summary: When an email is sent after an issue has been updated, the email has a header indicating what values have changed
When releasing project and rolling open issues to next release, give option to turn off emails.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32166].
  {panel}

It appears that rss feeds based on saved filters with 'fixVersion IS NULL' behave different than ones with 'fixVersion = 1234'.
I am trying to create some rss feeds to get notified when my boss moves issues in an out of fixVersions in hopes that I won't miss anything.  It has happened where something gets moved last minute without my knowledge we end up releasing the incorrect code.
I have asked my boss to inform me when this happens, but he continues to do this anyway.  My goal is to detect when he moves tickets in or out of the current fixVersion, so all the proper docs and commits can be updated appropriately.  

To that end, here is what I've attempted:
I have created 3 saved filters all based on fixVersions.
Here are the queries for the filters:
fixVersion=10236 AND status=Open
fixVersion IS NULL AND status=Open
fixVersion=10237 AND status=Open

Those filters are saved as requestIds 10228, 10229, and 10230 respectively.

From these, I have created the following rss feeds:
https://myCompany.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/10228/SearchRequest-10228.xml?os_authType=basic
https://myCompany.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/10229/SearchRequest-10229.xml?os_authType=basic
https://myCompany.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/10230/SearchRequest-10230.xml?os_authType=basic

I've imported these feeds into Thunderbird 2 and 3, and see all the issues currently in each fixVersion.

To test the feeds, I edit an issue with fixVersion 10236 so that it's fixVersion is now 'Unknown'.  The feed based on filter 10229 updates with a new item, as expected. Next I test the opposite case, where an item currently has fixVersion NULL and edit it to be 10236; the feed for filter 10228 is not updated with the new issue.

I also tested changing the fixVersion from 10236 to 10237 and again there was no notification. 

I only received notifications when issues were moved into fixVersion NULL.

My company is using Jira Studio 2.3
fields.summary: RSS feeds from saved filters not consistently returning results to rss readers
Also accept Command+Enter for submit in text area
Ability to set a read-only permission
Ability to sort Versions on JIRA
Mail handler should consider User Directory order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32154].
  {panel}

Currently the "Ability to view or edit an issue's due date" are bundled in 1 permission: Schedule Issues.
There can be a situation where a user-groups/project roles should be allowed to see the due date but not to edit it.
i.e.: our support wants to be able to tell our customers when a feature/a fix will be ready.
But they are not allowed to change the schedule.


We need to split the permission into two parts : 
# View, and
# Edit
fields.summary: Permission "Schedule Issues": View but not edit

fields.description: Within the last few days, I applied for an Atlassian On-demand account and it was created using what I'm assuming is the latest build of JIRA,6.0-OD-07.2, (this was not an option to select in the "Versions Affected" for this issue) build 6031.  As a side note, I migrated my data from 5.1.7, build 786.  I no longer have the capability to search for issues using the basic search, because the pop-up to refine search criteria when clicking "Project", "Issue Type", etc, is not displayed.  This does not appear to be a browser-specific issue, though I am using Google Chrome 25.0.1364.172 m.  The javascript console provides the information that you can see in the attachment to this issue when any of the fields that I'm trying to refine are clicked.  The advanced search criteria works as expected.
fields.summary: Basic Search does not provide pop-up for criteria selection

fields.description:

!screenshot.png!


The issues can also be seen in the [docs for this very site|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa?decorator=popup#ResolutionTypes].

It should say "Incomplete".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32146].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Bullet lists for nested items display incorrectly, with white space appearing. Additionally, preview displays the white space below where as the actual comment displays it above.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add the following to a comment:
{noformat}
* This is OK
* As is this (~[mention])
** And this one
* But it gets bad here!
{noformat}
# Preview it and watch for the white space.
# Save it and watch the white space 

For example:

* This is OK
* As is this ([~dcurrie@atlassian.com])
** And this one
* But it gets bad here!

h3. Expected Results

There is no white space in either preview or the saved comment where the arrow is pointed in the example screenie.

h3. Actual Results

There is white space, below and above the bullet.

h3. Notes

Without the mention the comment renders without error but the preview still renders incorrectly:

* This is OK
* As is this
** And this one
* But it gets bad here!
fields.summary: Bullet List displays too much white space and renders incorrectly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32132].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Using the REST command to execute transaction will return error 500 if the transition destination is a (-1) no result step (loop). 

h5. cURL command used
{code}
curl -D- -u admin:admin -X POST --data @"C:/Users/ChungPark/Desktop/data.json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:8527/rest/api/2/issue/PP-8/transitions?expand=transitions.fields
{code}

h5. json data
{code}
{
    "transition": {
        "id": "711"
    }
}
{code}

h4. Error thrown in REST client
{code}
Exception in thread "main" com.atlassian.jira.rest.client.RestClientException: Internal server error
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.client.internal.jersey.AbstractJerseyRestClient.invoke(AbstractJerseyRestClient.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.client.internal.jersey.AbstractJerseyRestClient.getAndParse(AbstractJerseyRestClient.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.client.internal.jersey.JerseyIssueRestClient.getIssue(JerseyIssueRestClient.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.client.internal.jersey.JerseyIssueRestClient.getIssue(JerseyIssueRestClient.java:133)
	at RestTry.main(RestTry.java:27)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:120)
Caused by: com.sun.jersey.api.client.UniformInterfaceException: Client response status: 500
	at com.sun.jersey.api.client.WebResource.handle(WebResource.java:676)
	at com.sun.jersey.api.client.WebResource.get(WebResource.java:191)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.client.internal.jersey.AbstractJerseyRestClient$1.call(AbstractJerseyRestClient.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.client.internal.jersey.AbstractJerseyRestClient.invoke(AbstractJerseyRestClient.java:54)
	... 9 more
{code}

h4. Error thrown in {{atlassian-jira.log}}
{code}
013-03-14 21:25:05,274 http-bio-8527-exec-1 ERROR admin 1285x3280x1 14nlcoe 127.0.0.1 /rest/api/latest/issue/WFP-3 [jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response

	at com.atlassian.labs.remoteapps.modules.oauth.OAuth2LOFilter.doFilter(OAuth2LOFilter.java:70)  <+3> (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:74) (IteratingFilterChain.java:42) (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.labs.remoteapps.util.http.bigpipe.RequestIdSettingFilter.doFilter(RequestIdSettingFilter.java:22)  <+43> (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:74) (IteratingFilterChain.java:42) (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:66) (JWDSendRedirectFilter.java:25) (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:74) (IteratingFilterChain.java:42) (ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:77) (ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:63) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:243) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:210) (ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:78) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:243) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:210) (AbstractCachingFilter.java:33) (AbstractHttpFilter.java:31) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:243) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:210) (AbstractEncodingFilter.java:41) (AbstractHttpFilter.java:31) (PathMatchingEncodingFilter.java:45) (AbstractHttpFilter.java:31) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:243) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:210) (JiraStartupChecklistFilter.java:74) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:243) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:210) (MultiTenantServletFilter.java:91) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:243) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:210) (ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:78) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:243) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:210) (StandardWrapperValve.java:225) (StandardContextValve.java:123) (AuthenticatorBase.java:472) (StandardHostValve.java:168) (ErrorReportValve.java:98) (StandardEngineValve.java:118) (AccessLogValve.java:927) (CoyoteAdapter.java:407) (AbstractHttp11Processor.java:1001) (AbstractProtocol.java:585) (JIoEndpoint.java:310)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.TransitionMetaBeanBuilder.getStatusFromStep(TransitionMetaBeanBuilder.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.TransitionMetaBeanBuilder.build(TransitionMetaBeanBuilder.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder.addTransitions(IssueBeanBuilder.java:138)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder.build(IssueBeanBuilder.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueResource.getIssue(IssueResource.java:434)
{code}

h4. Environment
The error only occurs when a REST client is used, such as [JIRA REST client|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.jira-rest-java-client]. Testing using cURL does not return any error.

When Stash is integrated to JIRA, the following message will be displayed when trying to browse JIRA issues linked to the problematic global transition:

{noformat}
Can't display issues
Either you don't have access to view them or they don't exist. Please contact your system administrator if you believe this is incorrect.
instead of the integration I was hoping for.
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
* Set a destination step for the affected transition.
* Do not set global transition as it only affects global transition. 

h4. UPDATE
Using a cURL command performing GET will return *{{{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}}}*.
fields.summary: Internal Server Error if transition destination is undefined or the same state as the original status
Consider Crucible Review Draft status as Open

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32129].

i were trying to see if the hipchat plugin works with jira 6.0 (it says up to 5.4 i think), but i failed, (cant found where add the notification hook at create for call hitchat), and when i tried to remove it, i had a 404 error on marketplace jira website.

then i remembered that i got a notification before, that they were an update for the marketplace (plugin manager), looks like it downloaded it fine, but at the installing failed somewhere, resulting in deleted plugins module :(


i tried running the installer again, with the update option, thinking that it would fix the issue, but nothing helped.

i dont really want to start back from zero for see plugins at jira back.. what i could do for fix it?.

log fires were really big, since i reinstalled.

also, i'm using mysql 5.5, linux centos 6. i had errors before, because max_allowed packet were too low, i've set it to 16mb fixing it.  (fixed errors on confluence plugins installing, but looks like this var was not the problem at updating the marketplace)

hope it got fixed in the new version.

thanks!.

When i edit an existing issue in Jira, and want to link a confluence page using the 'wizard', i can select the confluence page, but the wizard puts the wrong Page Url in the textbox: http://localhost:8090/pages/... instead of using the Server base Url.

Jira version: v5.2.6#849-sha1:560c048
Confluence version: 5.0.1

See also the attached files.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32076].
  {panel}

My company's security team ran a vulnerability scan against our JIRA and found this issue.  They advised me to bring it to your attention as an opportunity to improve security.

Summary:
{quote}
Some web frameworks collapse the POST and GET parameters into a single collection. This is a flawed design pattern from a security standpoint. If a page accepts POST parameters as GET parameters an attacker would be able to effect change on websites through Cross-Site Request Forgery or leverage this design flaw with other vulnerabilities to attack the system hosting the web application. POST variables and GET variables should be distinct and no attempt to collapse to two collections should occur.
{quote}

An example showing how to demonstrate the issue:
Input: {quote}
GET /login.jsp?atl_token&os_username=12345&os_password=foo&os_cookie=true&os_destination=%2fsecure%2fDashboard.jspa&login=Log%20In HTTP/1.1
Referer: https://ourJira.local:443/login.jsp
Accept: */*
Pragma: no-cache
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322)
Host: ft-jira.mattersight.net
X-Scan-Memo: Category="Audit"; Function="createStateRequestFromAttackDefinition"; SID="FBF9E4FEE5C7BA725AF21068F08BDAF6"; PSID="280981CE8E66BF997A623A77CC318FFD"; SessionType="AuditAttack"; CrawlType="None"; AttackType="Other"; OriginatingEngineID="8ca14a29-1566-423d-b9f8-f46aa279ec29"; AttackSequence="0"; AttackParamDesc=""; AttackParamIndex="0"; AttackParamSubIndex="0"; CheckId="10655"; Engine="Form+Accepts+GET+Variables"; Retry="False"; SmartMode="NonServerSpecificOnly"; ThreadId="55"; ThreadType="AuditDBReaderSessionDrivenAudit"; 
Connection: Keep-Alive
Cookie: CustomCookie=WebInspect78498ZX4A2C8EB0ABD54C51AC87E7A4AB6BBC75Y3A46;atlassian.xsrf.token=BOKD-JKJB-95MZ-P5IW|b6c98b43b2686e19d437215c8d0bdc6d5054a134|lout;JSESSIONID=072444395FA06364137381BBBF290A43
{quote}

Response:
{quote}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-AREQUESTID: 1310x84951x8
X-ASESSIONID: 13aee16
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
X-Seraph-LoginReason: AUTHENTICATED_FAILED
X-AUSERNAME: anonymous
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Date: Thu, 19 Apr 2012 20:50:29 GMT
Content-Length: 7751

<!DOCTYPE html>
...
{quote}
fields.summary: Security enhancement: do not allow POST parameters to be used in GETs

After setting up the *jira.date.time.picker.java.format* (server side) as:

- EEE MMM dd HH:mm:ss zzz yyyy (e.g. Tue Mar 05 14:22:12 EST 2013)

I'm not being able to set up the *jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format* as the corresponding part on the client side - which should be:

- %a %b %d %I:%M:%S %Z %Y

The system is not accepting the timezone format - *%Z*

  {panel}

Trying to update a field configuration when there are 500 custom fields is a bit of a pain. It would be useful, and a huge time saver, to be able to bulk update the field configuration.

For instance, I would like to checkbox select all fields on a field configuration and then Hide them. Then select several to show.

Perhaps there is a better way, I'm ready for ideas [~rkrishna]!

Thanks,
Nick

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32068].
  {panel}

A few teams have projects that contain 50-100 versions associated with.

The problem is that the "Version Picker" combo boxes, only show a certain number of matches, and then max out and don't display the rest.

If you have 25 versions that being with 1. and you type in 1. into the Fix Versions picker, you see some but not all of the auto-completed matches.

A few teams have projects that contain 50-100 versions associated with it.
The problems happens when you have many that begin with 1 for example. And if you type 1 into the Fix Version field. You see some but not all of the auto-completed matches. Even if you try to refine, you need to be able to see more of them. This implies that you remember exactly what all the versions are, but the whole point of auto-match is to help you remember.
fields.summary: Version Picker needs to display more options in the auto-complete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32056].
  {panel}

Configuration Tool does not recognize command for SQL Server.

Reported by customer on RHEL
Tested on Ubuntu 10.04.4

Tested on JIRA: 5.2.5, 5.2.6, 6.0EAP

Steps to Reproduce:
* Navigate to JIRA's bin folder
* Run *config.sh*
* Database Selection
* Attempt to select [S] SQL Server
* error: Unknown command 'S'

Sample:
{code}
dchan@liver:~/atlassian/jira6m02/bin$ ./config.sh 
Loading application properties from /home/dchan/atlassian/jira6m02/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties
Reading database configuration from /home/dchan/atlassian/application-data/jira6m02/dbconfig.xml
No graphics display available; using console.
----------------------
JIRA Configurator v1.1
----------------------

--- Main Menu ---
  [H] Configure JIRA Home
  [D] Database Selection
  [W] Web Server (incl. HTTP/HTTPs configuration)
  [A] Advanced Settings
  [S] Save and Exit
  [X] Exit without Saving

Main Menu> D

--- Database Selection ---
  Database Type : PostgreSQL
  Instance      : localhost:5432/dchan-jira6m02
  Connect As    : postgres / *****

  [H] HSQL (not for production use)
  [M] MySQL
  [O] Oracle
* [P] PostgreSQL
  [S] SQL Server (MS-SQL)

  [X] Return to Main Menu

Database Selection [P]> S
Unknown command 'S'

--- Database Selection ---
  Database Type : PostgreSQL
  Instance      : localhost:5432/dchan-jira6m02
  Connect As    : postgres / *****

  [H] HSQL (not for production use)
  [M] MySQL
  [O] Oracle
* [P] PostgreSQL
  [S] SQL Server (MS-SQL)

  [X] Return to Main Menu

Database Selection [P]> M
MySql Database Configuration.
Hostname ()> 
{code}
* Failed for SQL Server
* Worked for MySQL

h5. Workaround: Use the GUI version, or manually configure the database connection
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2008-3.ConfigureYourJIRAServertoConnecttoYourSQLServer2008Database
** aka, modify the *dbconfig.xml* file
fields.summary: Configuration Tool SQL Server Unknown Command

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32052].
  {panel}

*Summary of The Request*

JIRA [nested group option|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Nested+Groups] currently does not respect deactivated directory. When a directory is disabled, this option is still available even thought the other directory does not have "Nested Group" option enabled.

*Expected Behavior*

When a disabled directory with "Nested Group" option disabled, and no other active directory have that option enabled JIRA should not provided this option as it might lead to confusion
fields.summary: Nested Group Option Should Respect Deactivated Directory
Support Tomcat 7 Connection Pooling
Individual priorities for every project
Ability to see how much time I have logged for the week.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32044].
  {panel}

Provide the ability to utilize conditions on the initial Create step so that you can have post functions based on those conditions. 

Use Case: 
If an issue is associated with a client that is not live, I want to route the issue to our implementation organization. If an issue is associated with a client that is live, I want to route the issue to our support organization. 

The only way I can accomplish this is to either have two issue types: one for pre-live and one for post live. However, this seems overkill as it then requires additional maintenance and avoid having to move issues between issue types if the user initially chooses the wrong one. 
The other is require that they save and then submit because on submit I can create two transitions: one that is valid for each option of the issue field: Is Client Live? If yes, the assignment is A; if no, the assignment is B.  However, we have done this in a couple of work flows and find out that people forget to click submit because they complete all of the information on create and don't realize it is a two-step process. 

On create, since I can only route to one step, I need the condition option to evaluate the assignee.
fields.summary: Ability to have conditions on Create
Not possible to make required fields on an Issue Collector form

  {panel}

It seems that one of the most recent releases, the display of the number of issues within a specific filter on the Manage Filters screen has disappeared. We now have to execute the query to see the number of issues associated with the filter. Previously, the number of issues associated with each filter was displayed in a column when opening the Manage Filters page. Please see images below:

*Before*
!before.png!

*After*
!after.png!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32036].
  {panel}

The Inline Edit feature in JIRA is beneficial, but is incomplete.  The current functionality edits and saves each field individually as it is edited, and the edit is triggered via a single click which results in unanticipated changes to fields and user confusion.

My Suggestion to resolve this is as follows:
# Enter Inline Edit mode by double clicking on a field that can be edited.
# Once in Inline Edit mode, allow subsequent fields to be edited via a single click.
# Once editing is complete, user must click a Save button on the issue to commit all changes at the same time.

These changes will prevent users from accidentally changing fields on an issue while still keeping it easy to change multiple fields.  Then the single Save button which will commit all changes will then also prevent multiple Issue Updated Events from being triggered and flooding users with emails.  This also has some added benefits such as allowing plugins the ability to tap into that save function in order to validate fields and also enable field dependencies.

Please vote!
fields.summary: Inline edit behavior enhancements

Currently, there is only one configuration for Introduction Gadget in dashboard for logged in and logged out screen. 

Therefore removing the gadget from System Dashboard will remove it from logged out screen. 

It is suitable to have different configuration for the two situation. One for logged in screen (System Dashboard) and logged out screen. That way I can disable the one in logged in screen and retain the other one.

h4. Workaround
Minimize the logged in Introduction Gadget manually.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32010].
  {panel}

1. Create a 'Location Select List' field
2. Configure couple of options. For e.g. Sydney, Australia
3. Set one of the cities as Default value.

Notice that the Default Value section displays the location could not be found, while it renders the map perfectly on View Issue page
fields.summary: ConfigureCustomField page for the 'Location Select List'
